did.abstract: These are letters from Titian Ramsay Peale's brother, Benjamin Franklin Peale, mainly on family affairs, but also on the United States Mint, agriculture, the Civil War, photography, current events and B. F. Peale's collection of artifacts of the Stone Age. There are some letters from Titian Peale and his wife Lucinda.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by Charles Coleman Sellers and accessioned, 09/23/1945 (85128).

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: The papers of C. W. Peale and his family have been reproduced almost in their entirety in microfiche form (Lillian B. Miller, ed. "Collected papers of Charles Willson Peale and his family." Kraus Micorfilm, 1980).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Titian Ramsay Peale was a naturalist, explorer, and artist.

odd.head: Naval History Note
odd.p: The T. R. Peale Correspondence contains at least two items which may be of interest to naval historians:

list.head: Wilkes, Charles, 1798-1877. United States Exploring Expedition (1838-1842).
list.item: Stockton, Eliza Ferguson Peale. Letter to Titian R. Peale. 1842 July. Congratulates him on his return from the Wilkes expedition (United States Exploring Expedition). 1 page.
Peale, Titian Ramsay. Letter to Mary Florida Peale. 1842 November 6. Hopes to prepare papers for the Wilkes expedition (United States Exploring Expedition). 2 pages.
